verses.kjv: And Abraham was old, and well stricken in age: and the LORD had blessed Abraham in all things.
verses.ct: Abraham had grown very old, and the LORD had blessed Abraham in every way.

verses.kjv: And Abraham said unto his eldest servant of his house, that ruled over all that he had, Put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh:
verses.ct: Abraham spoke to the senior servant in his household, the one who managed everything he owned: "Please place your hand beneath my thigh."

verses.kjv: And I will make thee swear by the LORD, the God of heaven, and the God of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell:
verses.ct: "I want you to swear by the LORD, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not choose a wife for my son from among the Canaanite women, whose people surround me."

verses.kjv: But thou shalt go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son Isaac.
verses.ct: "Instead, travel to my homeland and to my relatives, and find a wife for my son Isaac there."

verses.kjv: And the servant said unto him, Peradventure the woman will not be willing to follow me unto this land: must I needs bring thy son again unto the land from whence thou camest?
verses.ct: The servant asked him, "What if the woman refuses to come back with me to this land? Should I then take your son to the country you originally came from?"

verses.kjv: And Abraham said unto him, Beware thou that thou bring not my son thither again.
verses.ct: Abraham replied, "Make certain that you never take my son back there."

verses.kjv: The LORD God of heaven, which took me from my father’s house, and from the land of my kindred, and which spake unto me, and that sware unto me, saying, Unto thy seed will I give this land; he shall send his angel before thee, and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from thence.
verses.ct: "The LORD God of heaven, who brought me away from my father's household and from the land of my relatives, who spoke to me and made an oath to me, saying, 'I will give this land to your offspring' — he will send his angel ahead of you so that you can find a wife for my son from there."

verses.kjv: And if the woman will not be willing to follow thee, then thou shalt be clear from this my oath: only bring not my son thither again.
verses.ct: "If the woman is unwilling to come with you, then you are released from this oath of mine. Just do not take my son back there under any circumstances."

verses.kjv: And the servant put his hand under the thigh of Abraham his master, and sware to him concerning that matter.
verses.ct: So the servant placed his hand beneath the thigh of his master Abraham and swore an oath to him regarding this matter.

verses.kjv: And the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master, and departed; for all the goods of his master were in his hand: and he arose, and went to Mesopotamia, unto the city of Nahor.
verses.ct: The servant selected ten of his master's camels and set out, carrying with him all kinds of valuable gifts from his master. He traveled to Mesopotamia, to the town where Nahor lived.

verses.kjv: And he made his camels to kneel down without the city by a well of water at the time of the evening, even the time that women go out to draw water.
verses.ct: He had the camels kneel down outside the town beside a well during the evening hour, the time when women come out to get water.

verses.kjv: And he said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, I pray thee, send me good speed this day, and shew kindness unto my master Abraham.
verses.ct: He prayed, "O LORD, God of my master Abraham, please grant me success today, and show kindness to my master Abraham."

verses.kjv: Behold, I stand here by the well of water; and the daughters of the men of the city come out to draw water:
verses.ct: "Here I am, standing beside this spring, and the young women of the town are coming out to draw water."

verses.kjv: And let it come to pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say, Let down thy pitcher, I pray thee, that I may drink; and she shall say, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed for thy servant Isaac; and thereby shall I know that thou hast shewed kindness unto my master.
verses.ct: "Let it happen that when I ask a young woman, 'Please lower your jar so I can have a drink,' and she responds, 'Go ahead and drink, and I will water your camels too' — let her be the one you have chosen for your servant Isaac. By this I will know that you have shown kindness to my master."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, before he had done speaking, that, behold, Rebekah came out, who was born to Bethuel, son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham’s brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.
verses.ct: Even before he finished praying, Rebekah appeared, carrying her jar on her shoulder. She was the daughter of Bethuel, who was the son of Milcah, the wife of Abraham's brother Nahor.

verses.kjv: And the damsel was very fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had any man known her: and she went down to the well, and filled her pitcher, and came up.
verses.ct: The young woman was extremely beautiful, a virgin whom no man had been intimate with. She went down to the spring, filled her jar, and came back up.

verses.kjv: And the servant ran to meet her, and said, Let me, I pray thee, drink a little water of thy pitcher.
verses.ct: The servant hurried over to meet her and said, "Please, may I have a small drink of water from your jar?"

verses.kjv: And she said, Drink, my lord: and she hasted, and let down her pitcher upon her hand, and gave him drink.
verses.ct: She replied, "Drink, my lord." She quickly lowered the jar onto her hand and let him drink.

verses.kjv: And when she had done giving him drink, she said, I will draw water for thy camels also, until they have done drinking.
verses.ct: After she had finished giving him a drink, she said, "I will also draw water for your camels until they have had their fill."

verses.kjv: And she hasted, and emptied her pitcher into the trough, and ran again unto the well to draw water, and drew for all his camels.
verses.ct: She quickly poured her jar into the trough and ran back to the well to draw more water, continuing until she had provided for all his camels.

verses.kjv: And the man wondering at her held his peace, to wit whether the LORD had made his journey prosperous or not.
verses.ct: The man watched her in silence, wondering whether the LORD had made his journey successful or not.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as the camels had done drinking, that the man took a golden earring of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets for her hands of ten shekels weight of gold;
verses.ct: When the camels had finished drinking, the man brought out a gold nose ring weighing half a shekel and two gold bracelets for her wrists weighing ten shekels.

verses.kjv: And said, Whose daughter art thou? tell me, I pray thee: is there room in thy father’s house for us to lodge in?
verses.ct: He asked, "Whose daughter are you? Please tell me — is there space in your father's house for us to spend the night?"

verses.kjv: And she said unto him, I am the daughter of Bethuel the son of Milcah, which she bare unto Nahor.
verses.ct: She answered, "I am the daughter of Bethuel, the son that Milcah bore to Nahor."

verses.kjv: She said moreover unto him, We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.
verses.ct: She added, "We have plenty of straw and feed, as well as space for you to stay overnight."

verses.kjv: And the man bowed down his head, and worshipped the LORD.
verses.ct: The man bowed his head and worshipped the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of my master Abraham, who hath not left destitute my master of his mercy and his truth: I being in the way, the LORD led me to the house of my master’s brethren.
verses.ct: He said, "Praise the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who has not withdrawn his mercy and his faithfulness from my master. As for me, the LORD has guided me on this journey straight to the home of my master's relatives."

verses.kjv: And the damsel ran, and told them of her mother’s house these things.
verses.ct: The young woman ran and reported all of this to her mother's household.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah had a brother, and his name was Laban: and Laban ran out unto the man, unto the well.
verses.ct: Rebekah had a brother named Laban, and Laban rushed out to the man at the well.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister’s hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.
verses.ct: When he noticed the nose ring and the bracelets on his sister's wrists, and when he heard Rebekah say, "This is what the man told me," he went to the man and found him standing with the camels by the well.

verses.kjv: And he said, Come in, thou blessed of the LORD; wherefore standest thou without? for I have prepared the house, and room for the camels.
verses.ct: Laban said, "Come inside, you who are blessed by the LORD! Why are you standing out here? I have prepared the house, and there is a place for the camels."

verses.kjv: And the man came into the house: and he ungirded his camels, and gave straw and provender for the camels, and water to wash his feet, and the men’s feet that were with him.
verses.ct: So the man entered the house. The camels were unloaded and given straw and feed, and water was brought to wash his feet and the feet of the men traveling with him.

verses.kjv: And there was set meat before him to eat: but he said, I will not eat, until I have told mine errand. And he said, Speak on.
verses.ct: Food was placed in front of him, but he said, "I will not eat until I have explained why I am here." Laban said, "Go ahead and tell us."

verses.kjv: And he said, I am Abraham’s servant.
verses.ct: He said, "I am a servant of Abraham."

verses.kjv: And the LORD hath blessed my master greatly; and he is become great: and he hath given him flocks, and herds, and silver, and gold, and menservants, and maidservants, and camels, and asses.
verses.ct: "The LORD has blessed my master abundantly, and he has become wealthy. He has been given flocks and herds, silver and gold, male and female servants, camels and donkeys."

verses.kjv: And Sarah my master’s wife bare a son to my master when she was old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath.
verses.ct: "Sarah, my master's wife, gave birth to a son for my master in her old age, and he has given that son everything he owns."

verses.kjv: And my master made me swear, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife to my son of the daughters of the Canaanites, in whose land I dwell:
verses.ct: "My master made me take an oath, saying, 'You must not select a wife for my son from the Canaanite women in whose land I live.'"

verses.kjv: But thou shalt go unto my father’s house, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son.
verses.ct: "'Instead, go to my father's family and to my relatives, and find a wife for my son there.'"

verses.kjv: And I said unto my master, Peradventure the woman will not follow me.
verses.ct: "I said to my master, 'What if the woman will not come back with me?'"

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, The LORD, before whom I walk, will send his angel with thee, and prosper thy way; and thou shalt take a wife for my son of my kindred, and of my father’s house:
verses.ct: "He told me, 'The LORD, in whose presence I have lived my life, will send his angel with you and make your mission successful. You are to find a wife for my son from among my relatives, from my father's family.'"

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou be clear from this my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if they give not thee one, thou shalt be clear from my oath.
verses.ct: "'You will be freed from my oath once you reach my relatives. If they refuse to give her to you, then you will also be released from my oath.'"

verses.kjv: And I came this day unto the well, and said, O LORD God of my master Abraham, if now thou do prosper my way which I go:
verses.ct: "When I arrived at the well today, I prayed, 'O LORD, God of my master Abraham, if you are willing, please make this journey of mine successful.'"

verses.kjv: Behold, I stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass, that when the virgin cometh forth to draw water, and I say to her, Give me, I pray thee, a little water of thy pitcher to drink;
verses.ct: "'Here I am, standing beside this spring. When a young woman comes out to draw water and I say to her, Please give me a small drink from your jar,'"

verses.kjv: And she say to me, Both drink thou, and I will also draw for thy camels: let the same be the woman whom the LORD hath appointed out for my master’s son.
verses.ct: "'and she tells me, Go ahead and drink, and I will draw water for your camels as well — let her be the woman the LORD has selected for my master's son.'"

verses.kjv: And before I had done speaking in mine heart, behold, Rebekah came forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto the well, and drew water: and I said unto her, Let me drink, I pray thee.
verses.ct: "Before I had even finished praying silently, Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder. She went down to the spring and drew water. I said to her, 'Please give me a drink.'"

verses.kjv: And she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder, and said, Drink, and I will give thy camels drink also: so I drank, and she made the camels drink also.
verses.ct: "She quickly lowered her jar from her shoulder and said, 'Drink, and I will water your camels too.' So I drank, and she gave the camels water as well."

verses.kjv: And I asked her, and said, Whose daughter art thou? And she said, The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor’s son, whom Milcah bare unto him: and I put the earring upon her face, and the bracelets upon her hands.
verses.ct: "I asked her, 'Whose daughter are you?' She replied, 'The daughter of Bethuel, Nahor's son, whom Milcah bore to him.' Then I placed the ring on her nose and the bracelets on her wrists."

verses.kjv: And I bowed down my head, and worshipped the LORD, and blessed the LORD God of my master Abraham, which had led me in the right way to take my master’s brother’s daughter unto his son.
verses.ct: "I bowed my head and worshipped the LORD, praising the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who had guided me along the right path to find the granddaughter of my master's brother for his son."

verses.kjv: And now if ye will deal kindly and truly with my master, tell me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the left.
verses.ct: "So now, if you intend to treat my master with kindness and faithfulness, tell me. If not, tell me that as well, so I can go one way or another."

verses.kjv: Then Laban and Bethuel answered and said, The thing proceedeth from the LORD: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.
verses.ct: Laban and Bethuel answered, "This has come from the LORD. We have no power to argue for or against it."

verses.kjv: Behold, Rebekah is before thee, take her, and go, and let her be thy master’s son’s wife, as the LORD hath spoken.
verses.ct: "Rebekah is here before you. Take her and go, and let her become the wife of your master's son, just as the LORD has directed."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, when Abraham’s servant heard their words, he worshipped the LORD, bowing himself to the earth.
verses.ct: When Abraham's servant heard their response, he bowed down to the ground and worshipped the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the servant brought forth jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and raiment, and gave them to Rebekah: he gave also to her brother and to her mother precious things.
verses.ct: The servant then brought out silver jewelry, gold jewelry, and clothing, and presented them to Rebekah. He also gave costly gifts to her brother and her mother.

verses.kjv: And they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him, and tarried all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said, Send me away unto my master.
verses.ct: Then he and the men with him ate and drank and stayed the night. In the morning when they got up, he said, "Let me return to my master."

verses.kjv: And her brother and her mother said, Let the damsel abide with us a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.
verses.ct: But her brother and mother said, "Let the young woman remain with us for a while, perhaps ten days or so. After that, she may go."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Hinder me not, seeing the LORD hath prospered my way; send me away that I may go to my master.
verses.ct: He replied, "Do not delay me, since the LORD has made my journey successful. Let me leave so I can go back to my master."

verses.kjv: And they said, We will call the damsel, and enquire at her mouth.
verses.ct: They said, "We will call the young woman and ask her directly."

verses.kjv: And they called Rebekah, and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said, I will go.
verses.ct: So they called Rebekah and asked her, "Are you willing to go with this man?" She answered, "I will go."

verses.kjv: And they sent away Rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and Abraham’s servant, and his men.
verses.ct: So they sent off their sister Rebekah along with her nurse, and Abraham's servant and his men.

verses.kjv: And they blessed Rebekah, and said unto her, Thou art our sister, be thou the mother of thousands of millions, and let thy seed possess the gate of those which hate them.
verses.ct: They blessed Rebekah and said to her, "Our sister, may you become the mother of countless multitudes, and may your offspring take control of the cities of their enemies."

verses.kjv: And Rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the camels, and followed the man: and the servant took Rebekah, and went his way.
verses.ct: Rebekah and her attendants got up, mounted the camels, and followed the man. So the servant took Rebekah and departed.

verses.kjv: And Isaac came from the way of the well Lahairoi; for he dwelt in the south country.
verses.ct: Now Isaac had come from the direction of Beer Lahai Roi, for he was living in the Negev region.

verses.kjv: And Isaac went out to meditate in the field at the eventide: and he lifted up his eyes, and saw, and, behold, the camels were coming.
verses.ct: Isaac had gone out into the field to meditate during the evening. He looked up and saw camels approaching.

verses.kjv: And Rebekah lifted up her eyes, and when she saw Isaac, she lighted off the camel.
verses.ct: Rebekah also looked up, and when she noticed Isaac, she got down from her camel.

verses.kjv: For she had said unto the servant, What man is this that walketh in the field to meet us? And the servant had said, It is my master: therefore she took a vail, and covered herself.
verses.ct: She had asked the servant, "Who is that man walking through the field toward us?" The servant had answered, "That is my master." So she took her veil and covered herself.

verses.kjv: And the servant told Isaac all things that he had done.
verses.ct: The servant reported to Isaac everything he had done.

verses.kjv: And Isaac brought her into his mother Sarah’s tent, and took Rebekah, and she became his wife; and he loved her: and Isaac was comforted after his mother’s death.
verses.ct: Isaac brought her into the tent of his mother Sarah. He married Rebekah, and she became his wife, and he loved her. So Isaac found comfort after the loss of his mother.
